topic.title: Import your Templates into your Org.

othermeta.name: title
othermeta.content: Import your Templates into your Org.

othermeta.name: shortdesc
othermeta.content: In your org, go to Object Manager and search for the target SObject. Use the template importer to upload and map templates to the object fields for invoice generation.

li.p: In your org, go to Object Manager and search for Power Template (APXTPower4__Power_Template__c)
Go to Fields and Relationships, click New and select Text for the field type. Give it the label "Old ID" and a Length value of 255.
Determine the Visibility of the field, ensure that at minimum System Administrators have access to the new Old ID field. It does not have to be added to the Page Layout. Click Save.
Copy the API name of the Field (Old_ID__c) and go to your extracted file for your Templates.
Find the ID field in the document and paste the Old_ID__c value over the ID column header.
Open Salesforce Data Loader, click Insert.

note.p: If your template Name field contains a "-" in the label (example: CQT-0004), you may run into problems with Data Loader. To work around this, navigate to Salesforce Data Loader > Settings and confirm that "Read all CSVs with UTF-8 encoding" is enabled, and remove the "-" from the "Other Delimiters for load operations".
It is also recommended to enable "Use Bulk API".

li.p: Select the Power Template (APXTPower4__Power_Template__c) object, then select your file to import it.
In the Mapping popup, click the Create a Map button, then drag and drop your fields to map them to the correct column header. Most importantly, map the Old_ID__c field to the Old_ID__c field.
Save your mapping to your local machine and click Finish.
On the Finish popup, click Browse to choose where your Results file will appear. Begin the Import.
Once completed, click the View Successes button, then click Open in external program to receive a new Success Export file.
